reporting_cycle: The Committee shall report to the Council on its findings regarding Member Statesâ€™ implementation efforts, and identify and recommend steps necessary to improve implementation.
summary:
30. The Committee will continue to consider delisting requests from Member States for individuals/groups that no longer meet the criteria.

31. States are encouraged to submit delisting requests for deceased individuals or entities that have ceased to exist.

32. When unfreezing assets of deceased individuals/entities, States should prevent them from being used for terrorist purposes.

33. The Committee should consider opinions of designating States, States of residence/nationality, and other relevant States when reviewing delisting requests.

34. Member States are encouraged to provide information to the Committee on delisting petitions.

35. The Secretariat will notify States of residence/nationality of delistings within 3 days, and States will inform the concerned individual/entity in a timely manner.

36. Member States are encouraged to submit additional information on listed individuals/groups to the Committee.
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

**Review and Update of Al-Qaida Sanctions List**

* Requests the Monitoring Team to circulate to the Committee every six months a list of individuals and entities on the Al-Qaida Sanctions List whose entries lack identifiers (para 37)
* Directs the Committee to review listings of deceased individuals and remove them where credible information is available (para 38)
* Directs the Committee to review listings of entities that have ceased to exist and remove them where credible information is available (para 39)
* Directs the Committee to conduct an annual review of all names on the Al-Qaida Sanctions List that have not been reviewed in three or more years (para 40)

**Measures Implementation**

* Reiterates the importance of implementing fully all aspects of the measures described (para 41)
* Directs the Committee to ensure fair and clear procedures exist for placing individuals and entities on the Al-Qaida List and for removing them (para 42)
* Directs the Committee to review its guidelines with respect to the provisions of this resolution (para 43)

**Coordination and Outreach**

* Encourages Member States to meet with the Committee for in-depth discussion on relevant issues (para 44)
* Requests the Committee to report to the Council on its findings regarding Member States' implementation efforts (para 45)
* Directs the Committee to identify possible cases of non-compliance and determine the appropriate course of action (para 46)

**Additional Requests**
